title-rule.text: If starting the adventure here, the group gains 1 potion.

flavor.text: The shoreline near the Southwest Camp basks in the overhead sun, bright light reflecting from the shallow pools where Kestodon and Aptonoth water. Ahead you see the entrance to the Ancient Forest, formed by an arch of thick boughs, yawning open like a gaping maw… the sounds from the world behind you fade away to silence as you step under the rich green canopy, leaving an all-too-brief sense of calm, soon broken as the Scoutflies excitedly cluster around a huge footprint in the soil.

prompt.text: Follow the Scoutflies!

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Gain 1 track token.
Progress to entry 21.

title-rule.text: If starting the adventure here, the group gains 2 potions.

flavor.text: A Great Jagras is on the loose; the last week has presented you with plentiful evidence – dozens of corpses, ripped apart in a frenzy, and left half eaten. This will be a hunt to test even the most experienced of trackers. You’ve heard of Jagras consuming hunters in a single bite. That won’t be you.

consequences.text: Each hunter gains 1 Great Jagras Claw.

prompt.text: Hit the trail running?

rules.text: Gain 1 track token. Progress to entry 27.

prompt.text: Stay and dig around the remains?

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card.
Each hunter gains 1 Monster Bone medium.
Progress to entry 25.

prompt.text: Race to where your prey was last seen!

rules.text: Discard 5 time cards. Progress to entry 30.

title-rule.text: If starting the adventure here, the group gains 1 potion.

flavor.text: The handler standing by the tracks gives you an appraising glance. ‘I’d be very careful pursuing this beast,’ she says, idly scratching her chin. ‘It’s aggressive even by Jagras standards. But, if you insist on tracking it, take that route…’ she gestures to a dirt path leading into the forest. ‘It’s still hungry. Good luck!’ Her warning said, she vanishes into the forest.

prompt.text: Follow her advice, and slowly advance.

rules.text: Gain and reveal 1 track token, then choose whether to keep or discard it. Progress to entry 26.

prompt.text: With so many tracks, there’s no time to waste!

rules.text: Gain 2 track tokens. Progress to entry 16.

prompt.text: Race to where your prey was last seen!

rules.text: Discard 5 time cards. Progress to entry 30.

title-rule.text: If starting the adventure here, the group gains 2 potions.

flavor.text: The beach stretches out before you, an exquisite expanse of untouched sand. The sea surges across it, leaving glistening foam to mark each wave. The forest rises behind you, an oppressive memory, but you may have to withdraw back into its ferny grip and leave this beautiful scene behind. Do you…

prompt.text: Head down the beach.

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Gain 1 track token.
Progress to entry 22.

prompt.text: Head back into the forest, towards a camp you can see between the trees.

rules.text: Discard 1 time card. Progress to entry 9.

prompt.text: Race to where your prey was last seen!

rules.text: Discard 5 time cards. Progress to entry 30.

title-rule.text: If starting the adventure here, the group gains 1 potion.

flavor.text: The thunder of water threatens to distract your mind as you scan the nearby terrain. Great Jagras is on the hunt, and you’re on its trail. The river below surges into the forest, and the thick foliage of the trees obscures the path of the creature you seek.

prompt.text: Follow what tracks you can.

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Gain 2 track tokens.
Progress to entry 13.

prompt.text: Investigate the area.

rules.text: Discard 2 time cards. Each Hunter gains 1 Piercing Claw and 1 Monster Bone Large. Progress to entry 24.

prompt.text: Head downriver to where Great Jagras was last seen.

rules.text: Discard 1 time cards. Progress to entry 14.

prompt.text: Race to where your prey was last seen!

rules.text: Discard 5 time cards. Progress to entry 30.

flavor.text: Just when you are about to lose heart you come across a pile of Great Jagras dung, left in the wake of your prey. It may be a grisly sight, but it fills your heart with hope as you head for a clearing ahead.

prompt.text: No time to look back.

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Gain 3 track tokens.
Progress to entry 18.

prompt.text: Wait, listen… is that something behind us?

rules.text: Progress to entry 30.

flavor.text: Flickering light paints eerie shadows across the walls, dancing pools of  darkness that give mind to vicious predators. Your feet kick up dust and  crunch through tiny bones, revealing sparkling metals and gems…

prompt.text: Search the cave.

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card.
Each hunter rolls on the following table.

1-2 Gain 1 Dragonite Ore
3-4 Gain 1 Fucium Ore
5-6 Gain 1 Ancient Bone

Once each hunter has rolled.
Progress to entry 11.

prompt.text: Turn back from this sinister place.

rules.text: Progress to entry 30.

flavor.text: Have you been this way before? Things look familiar. But then…the forest  always looks familiar. You’re definitely lost. Eventually, you see a cave,  something in the rocks outside glittering in the sun. You’re about to use  your pick, when you see some tracks, half buried in the dust.

prompt.text: Mine the ore, then enter the cave.

rules.text:
Discard 1 track token.
Each hunter rolls on the following table.

1-2 Gain 1 Dragonite Ore
3-4 Gain 1 Fucium Ore
5-6 Gain 1 Firecell Ore

Once each hunter has rolled. Progress to entry 7.

prompt.text: Follow the tracks you can see, and hope they’re fresh.

rules.text: Discard 1 time card. Gain 1 track token. Progress to entry 6.

flavor.text: A host of Palico gather at the edge of the camp as you draw near, mewing with interest. The creatures quickly resume their training drills, dodging and darting around the encampment as you take a few moments to rest. The hunt has to continue, but, for a few moments, being among the Palico is a cure for the perils of your work.

prompt.text: Ask for their aid.

rules.text:
Each hunter that does not have a Palico draws a Palico card.
They may use it during the next hunting phase, then it is discarded. Progress to entry 29.

prompt.text: Ask for a guide.

rules.text:
Gain and reveal 4 track tokens, then choose whether to keep or discard them.
Progress to entry 19.

flavor.text: You’ve stalked through the forest, intricately and carefully made your way…to the same cave you’ve visited many times before. Still, perhaps, there might yet be some ore to be discovered.

rules.text:
Roll a die.
On a 1-4 all of the ore has been mined.
Time to hurry on. Progress to entry 18.
On a 5-6 there’s still some here. Discard 1 time card.
Each hunter gains 1 Carbalite ore, and 1 Machalite ore.
Progress to entry 7.

flavor.text: Something huge has clearly passed through this way, fresh markings cover the walls where it squeezed its huge bulk through the passageway. This warren is a maze; you can either rush on blindly, or stop to get your bearings.

prompt.text: Keep moving!

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Gain 2 track tokens.
Progress to entry 30.

prompt.text: Advance carefully.

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Reveal up to three tokens from the pool.
Progress to entry 18.

flavor.text: Lightheaded and breathing heavily, you lean against the bark of a thick  tree. Your arms ache, numbness creeping through them towards your  shoulders. If only there were a way to relieve your parched throat…

prompt.text: Force yourselves to go on.

rules.text: All hunters suffer 2 damage. Progress to entry 6.

prompt.text: Drink from your supplies.

condition.text: (The hunters may only choose this option if they have at least 1 potion)

rules.text: Discard 1 potion. Progress to entry 6.

flavor.text: ‘What can I help you with?’ says the small man as you pass him. You should have recognised him as a trader sooner. He grins and gestures to the pack on his back. ‘I’ve got anything you might need, just here!’ You’re sure he does, but you know it’s going to cost you…

rules.text:
The players may discard any three resources, and add 1 Potion to the pool, or gain 1 track token.
If they do, discard 1 time card.
Progress to entry 10.

flavor.text: ‘Your prey is near… keep up the pace!’ intones a voice, from somewhere amidst the trees. You can’t locate the voice, but it isn’t wrong. Great Jagras is close, and you’re gaining on it. It won’t take much to bring it to heel… but who is speaking to you?

consequences.text: Each hunter gains 1 Great Jagras Claw.

prompt.text: Investigate the voice.

rules.text: Progress to entry 13.

prompt.text: Ignore it and continue searching through the creature’s nest.

condition.text: (The players may only select this option if they have at least 1 Great Jagras Hide in their inventories)

rules.text:
Discard 2 time cards. Gain 1 Great Jagras Mane.
Progress to entry 24.

flavor.text: The light has begun to dim, the sun setting behind the tall trees on the horizon. If you plan on maintaining the hunt, you’ll need to race ahead, or you can make camp for the evening and resume tomorrow.

prompt.text: We can’t waste any time. Keep up the chase!

rules.text:
Shuffle the Rushed Advance card into the time deck.
Progress to entry 30.

prompt.text: Strike camp for the night.

rules.text:
Discard 2 time cards, all hunters heal to full.
Progress to entry 19.

flavor.text: A roar fills the air, echoing across the forest. The beast is nearby. A discarded pack lies on the ground in the middle of the path, the strap torn. But is this a trap?

prompt.text: Check the bag.

rules.text:
Roll a die.
On a 1-2 No time!
Progress to entry 27.
On a 3-4 Take the bag before it is upon you!
Add 1 potion to the pool. Progress to entry 27.
On a 5-6 Snatch up the ores from the ground!
Each hunter gains 1 Carbalite ore, and 1 Machalite ore.
Progress to entry 27.

prompt.text: Leave it and explore through a gap in the trees.

rules.text: Progress to entry 29.

flavor.text: Another dead Great Jagras. This one was brought down from above… some vast aerial predator ripped it to shreds. You scan the air carefully, desperate to ensure that you aren’t surprised as Great Jagras was, but the corpse is intact. You want that hide… and those scales.

consequences.text: Each hunter gains 1 Great Jagras Hide.

prompt.text: Carefully procure a scale?

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card.
Gain 1 Great Jagras Scale.
Progress to entry 6.

prompt.text: The trail is growing cold!

rules.text: Progress to entry 28.

flavor.text: You emerge into brilliant sunlight, a fast-flowing river gurgling beside you. A trail of fresh footprints has been stamped into the mud, a path leading you forward.

prompt.text: Follow the tracks.

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Gain 1 track token.
Progress to entry 28.

prompt.text: Stop to examine them more closely.

rules.text:
Discard 2 time cards. Discard 1 track token.
Progress to entry 15.

flavor.text: A new day dawns over the Ancient Forest, revealing fresh footprints through the morning dew. Your prey is close, and for a moment you wonder if you are the hunter or the hunted…

rules.text:
If the group has four or less track tokens, gain 1 track token.
Progress to entry 30.

flavor.text: For a moment, as you move through the jungle, you’re convinced the Great Jagras has caught you. Until the vast beast remains unmoving, even as you approach it. The creature is dead. Dead of old age, it looks like. Its eyes are pale with cataracts, its scales no longer vibrant. You’ve beaten the scavengers to the corpse, it’s untouched. It won’t last long.

prompt.text: Scavenge the body.

rules.text:
Discard 2 time cards. Each hunter gains 1 Great Jagras Scale.
If the group has at least 1 Great Jagras Mane, each hunter also gains 1 additional Great Jagras Mane.
Progress to entry 15.

prompt.text: Return to the trail, and head for a camp you can see between the trees.

rules.text: Progress to entry 9.

flavor.text: You follow a well-used trail, scrapes and gouges in the dirt and along the trees betraying the monsters that frequently pass through this way. The gnawed bone of a monster, picked clean of meat, lays discarded to one side.

consequences.text: Each hunter gains 1 Monster Bone medium.

prompt.text: Hurry to follow the tracks along the trail?

rules.text: Gain 1 track token. Progress to entry 23.

prompt.text: Stop to search for other bones nearby?

rules.text: Discard 1 time card. Each hunter gains 1 Quality Bone and 1 Monster Bone Small. Progress to entry 23.

flavor.text: Two butchered Kestodon lie exposed beneath the unforgiving sun. Their flesh is already starting to turn. You’ve only got a few hours before anything useful on either corpse will be ruined by descending scavengers.

prompt.text: Prioritise scavenging.

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Each hunter gains 1 Piercing Claw,
and 1 Monster Hardbone. Progress to entry 25.

prompt.text: Forget the corpse. Prioritise tracking.

rules.text: Discard 1 time card. Gain 1 track tokens. Progress to entry 20.

flavor.text: The trees ahead are far older and have considerably thicker foliage—it  would be exhausting to hack through. Alternatively, a trail of ore along the path leads to a large cave opening in the distance. You might search there, in hope of finding your prey’s den…

consequences.text: Each hunter gains 1 Carbalite ore, and 1 Machalite ore.

prompt.text: Cut your way through the forest.

rules.text: Discard 1 time card. Progress to entry 12.

prompt.text: Backtrack to the cave entrance.

rules.text: Discard 2 time cards. Progress to entry 7.

flavor.text: After an hour’s exploration of the area, you stumble across something strange. A series of unusual shapes wreathed in green. You manage to strip away the moss and vines grown around the strange stone idols, before you recognise what they are. Ancient funeral stones, long forgotten.

prompt.text: Swear to avenge the spirits.

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card.
Shuffle a Jagras Slayer card into time deck.
Progress to entry 27.

prompt.text: Dip your head reverently… but hurry on.

rules.text:
Shuffle an Unavenged card into time deck.
Progress to entry 26.

flavor.text: The brush nearby contains another corpse. Another dead Aptonoth. But it might be worth examining further. Gleaning any details about Great Jagras might be invaluable later.

prompt.text: Spend some time cleaning the bones off so you can take them with you?

rules.text:
Discard 2 time cards.
Each hunter gains 1 Monster Bone Large and 1 Great Jagras Scale. Progress to entry 27.

prompt.text: We’ve spent enough time here.

rules.text: Progress to entry 8.

flavor.text: A vast assemblage of bones, desiccated flesh, and shattered teeth greets you as you step out of the ring of trees. This is where the titans come to die; a monster graveyard. Nearby, there’s a fresh carcass. From the marks on its throat, it was a victim of Great Jagras. Another one. You’re on its trail though, and from what you know of the beast’s path, there’s a shortcut that should bring you out right on top of it…

prompt.text: Take the time to strip the carcass.

rules.text:
Discard 2 time cards. Each hunter gains 1 Monster Keenbone.
Progress to entry 29.

prompt.text: Follow the shortcut.

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Gain 2 track tokens.
Progress to entry 28.

prompt.text: What’s that shaggy pile over there?

condition.text: (The players may only choose this option if they have at least 1 Great Jagras hide in their inventories)

rules.text: Progress to entry 17.

flavor.text: Small Jagras erupt from the brush, surrounding and snapping at you with desperate hunger. You’re overwhelmed, and, for a moment, think you might be dragged under. Your training gets you through, driving the pack away and giving you a moment to breathe. But they’re about to attack again…

prompt.text: Fight off the pack.

rules.text:
Discard 2 time cards. Each hunter suffers 1 damage,
then gains 1 Sharp Claw. Progress to entry 12.

prompt.text: Flee through the undergrowth.

rules.text: Discard 1 time card. Progress to entry 29.

flavor.text: A scream cuts through the air. Up ahead, a bloodied satchel lays unattended on the ground—it seems that something has caught up with one of the field researchers. Surely you can’t leave them to their fate, can you?

prompt.text: No, we can’t. Abandon the hunt to save them!

rules.text:
Discard 1 track token and shuffle a Researcher’s Favour
card into the time deck. Progress to entry 15.

prompt.text: Yes, we can. Search the satchel, and head for a safer location.

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Each hunter gains 1 Coral Crystal,
then add 1 Potion to the pool. Progress to entry 19.

flavor.text: The carcass you’ve stumbled upon is impossibly old. Older than mankind, you’re sure. A creature long forgotten but still, even in death, magnificent. Your breath catches in your throat as you imagine the battles this creature must have fought.

prompt.text: Reverently take a bone before leaving.

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Each hunter gains 1 Ancient Bone.
Progress to entry 6.

prompt.text: Leave this tranquil scene undisturbed.

rules.text: Discard 1 time card. Shuffle an Ancient Guardian card into time deck. Progress to entry 18.

flavor.text: A deafening roar is your only warning, as you suddenly find yourself face to face with your prey! Now is the time to fight this terrifying adversary.

rules.text: Reveal your track tokens, check the Scoutfly level, and begin the hunting phase.

title-rule.text: If starting the adventure here, the group gains 1 potion.

flavor.text: Always accompanied by the unmistakeable scent of ozone, Tobi-Kadachi spears its way through the trees, dropping close to the ground in search of prey. Its hunger is legendary, as is the static electricity rippling along and across its fur. You’re prepared to hunt it, or as prepared as you can be. The beast awaits, and you’re on its tracks.

prompt.text: Head into the dense forest.

rules.text: Discard 1 time card. Each hunter gains 1 Dragonvein Crystal, and 1 Dragonite ore. Progress to entry 12.

prompt.text: Race to where your prey was last seen!

rules.text: Discard 6 time cards. Progress to entry 34.

title-rule.text: If starting the adventure here, the group gains 2 potions.

flavor.text: Up in the boughs, something is waiting. It’s a Tobi-Kadachi, you’re certain of it. Clambering up the tree, your suspicions are confirmed. A nest… and it’s still warm. The creature that built it is nearby.

prompt.text: Wait at the nest for Tobi-Kadachi to return!

condition.text: (The hunters may only choose this option if they have completed the Tobi-Kadachi Assigned Quest)

rules.text: Discard 6 time cards. Progress to entry 34.

prompt.text: The beast smashed through here…

rules.text: Each hunter gains 1 Tobi-Kadachi Pelt. Progress to entry 18.

title-rule.text: If starting the adventure here, the group gains 1 potion.

flavor.text: Tobi-Kadachi is bold, and lethal. It’s attacked a camp, leaving other hunters dead or injured. And you need to stop it, before the commission is driven from the forest altogether. Its depredations leave ruination behind it, and that’s what you’re standing in now. Ruins.

prompt.text: Head to the last place the beast was seen.

rules.text: Progress to entry 10.

prompt.text: Make the best of it.

rules.text:
Search for resources! Discard 1 time card. Each hunter gains 1 Monster Bone Small, and 1 Monster Hardbone.
Progress to entry 25.

prompt.text: Race to where your prey was last seen!

rules.text: Discard 6 time cards. Progress to entry 34.

title-rule.text: If starting the adventure here, the group gains 2 potions.

flavor.text: The sound of the waterfall drew you here. The endless pulsing roar is soothing, and you’ve heard that a good swimmer can find valuable things in the pool beneath. But as you watch the churning, seething waters, you catch the scent of ozone on the breeze, and hear the sound of wings lashing at the air. A Tobi-Kadachi is nearby. And you need to bring it down.

prompt.text: Dive into the waterfall.

rules.text:
Discard 2 time cards.
Each hunter rolls on the following table.
1-2 Gain 1 Ancient Bone
3-4 Gain 1 Warm Pelt
5-6 Gain 1 Coral Crystal
Once each hunter has rolled, progress to entry 11.

prompt.text: Leave it behind and backtrack to the cave.

rules.text: Discard 1 time card. Progress to entry 29.

prompt.text: Race to where your prey was last seen!

rules.text: Discard 6 time cards. Progress to entry 34.

title-rule.text: If starting the adventure here, the group gains 1 potion.

flavor.text: You’ve rested up, recovered from the rigours of your last hunt. And now there’s another hunt in the offing. You’d heard a Tobi-Kadachi was on the hunt but now it’s being hunted by you. It’s left plenty of evidence that it was here… stones kicked around all over the ground. Time to get on the trail.

prompt.text: Follow the Scoutflies.

rules.text:
Discard 2 time cards. Gain 4 track tokens.
Progress to entry 8.

prompt.text: This isn’t a stone—I recognise it from before. Collect the discarded part, then follow the lonely trail to the graveyard.

condition.text: (The players may only choose this option if they have at least 1 Tobi-Kadachi Membrane in their inventories)

rules.text:
Gain 3 track tokens. Each hunter gains 1
Tobi-Kadachi Membrane. Progress to entry 25.

prompt.text: Race to where your prey was last seen!

rules.text: Discard 6 time cards. Progress to entry 34.

flavor.text: A pile of smashed rock is strewn across the ground. Dropped by some flying predator, perhaps? Or tossed aside by a miner who didn’t know what they’d found…ore glistens among the fragments of stone. Yours for the taking!

prompt.text: Gather up the stones?

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Each hunter rolls a die.
1-2 Gain 1 Dragonite ore
3-4 Gain 1 Dragonvein Crystal
5-6 Gain 1 Coral Crystal
Once each player has rolled, progress to entry 26.

prompt.text: Stop to examine your surroundings.

rules.text:
Discard 1 track token or gain 1 track token.
Progress to entry 35.

flavor.text: It’s a nest. Larger than any you’ve seen before, though you find it difficult to tell whether the creature still visits here. It’s a strange place; electricity still lingers in the air, making your hair pick itself up off your skin. Time to press on?

prompt.text: Stay on the road.

rules.text:
Discard 2 time cards. Gain 2 track tokens.
Progress to entry 35.

prompt.text: Hidden electrodes react to the one in your possession, crackling and making their locations easy to find.

condition.text: (The players may only select this option if they have at least 1 Electrode in their inventories)

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Gain 1 track token.
Each hunter gains 1 Tobi-Kadachi Electrode.
Progress to entry 17.

flavor.text: It’s been quite the journey, but you’ve returned to the nest. The creature is certain to return, all you need to do is wait, or you can examine the remains its left here. Learning how the creature hunts and kills is vital information, especially if you’re going to take the beast down.

prompt.text: Gather the remains, then get going!

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Gain 2 track tokens.
Each hunter gains 1 Monster Bone small or 1 Monster Bone large. Progress to entry 6.

prompt.text: It came here to die, looking at all of the parts dotted around the ground.

A brief search of the area reveals a few Aptonoth bones, picked clean. The start of a trail, perhaps? But there are rumours of Anjanath in the next valley. What do your hunter’s instincts say?

Judging by the bite radius, it was an Anjanath that slaughtered it. You spit, trying to cleanse your mouth of the taste of rotting flesh, and then brace yourself for the hunt.

prompt.text: Shuffle the Recovery card into the time deck.

rules.text: Progress to entry 7.

flavor.text: The forest is clearly Rathalos’ favoured hunting ground. You find discarded bones and flesh hanging from branches, and, in several places, the half-devoured remnants of recent meals.

prompt.text: Continue to stalk your prey through the forest.

rules.text: Gain 1 track token. Progress to entry 12.

prompt.text: Examine the devoured prey more closely.

rules.text:
Each hunter gains 1 Rathalos Scale. Discard 2 time cards.
Progress to entry 29.

prompt.text: Are those… more Rathalos scales? You’d recognise them anywhere.

condition.text: (This option can only be chosen if the hunters have at least 1 Rathalos Scale in their inventories)

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card.
Progress to entry 8.

flavor.text: Tracking the creature leads you to the edge of a small lake. It dives to drink from the water but you’re too far away to capitalise on the opportunity. Instead, as Rathalos soars back into the air, you wonder whether sifting through the sand on the lake shore might reveal anything of value, or perhaps it’s time to head back into the forest?

prompt.text: Explore the small beach.

rules.text:
Each hunter gains 1 Coral Crystal and 1 Rathalos Shell.
Progress to entry 22.

prompt.text: Plunge back into the trees.

rules.text:
Each hunter gains 1 Warm Pelt.
Gain 1 track token.
Progress to entry 13.

flavor.text: You’re near to it. You’re certain. The disturbances in the trees are the sign you’ve been looking for. Don’t let it get away!

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card.
Progress to entry 35.

flavor.text: A Rathalos nest—just ahead of you! It’s empty but… if you can reach it… you’re sure it contains something that’ll help you trap your prey. It’s just a short climb up a sheer cliff. What could go wrong?

rules.text:
Roll a die.
On a 1-3 The hunters each suffer 2 damage as they tumble downwards and have to scramble back up.
Discard 2 time cards. Progress to entry 28.
On a 4-6 The hunters gain 3 track tokens as
they make the climb unscathed.
Discard 1 time card. Progress to entry 28

flavor.text: The peace of the forest is absolute. No sounds, nothing… except the stench of rotting meat assailing you, suddenly, from somewhere nearby. And then, above you, you hear something!

prompt.text: Rathalos!

rules.text: Gain 1 track token. Progress to entry 32.

flavor.text: Your progress stalls. You were so close. But now, Rathalos seems to have fled from the beating it took at the claws of its intended prey. No sightings and no evidence of it can be found. You won’t turn back, but you can’t prevent yourself from becoming somewhat dispirited.

rules.text: Progress to entry 15.

flavor.text: The clifftops are rich with evidence of Rathalos activity. At least one creature frequents this place regularly, though it no longer uses this place for its nest. If you wish to catch it, you must move on. But it might be worth making camp here; Rathalos may return, and you could use the rest.

prompt.text: Ignore the tiredness in your bones. Keep hunting.

rules.text: The hunters gain 1 track token. Progress to entry 10.

prompt.text: Shelter here for the night.

rules.text:
Each hunter recovers 2 health. Discard 1 time card.
Shuffle the Wake Up! card into the time deck.
Progress to entry 29.

flavor.text: One of the combatants certainly came this way. If you’re the judge, probably the one that came off best in the fight. But that’s a relative term. There are splashes of blood even this far into the forest.

prompt.text: Explore the area.

rules.text:
Gain 1 track token. Discard 1 time card.
Progress to entry 19.

prompt.text: Keep up the pursuit.

rules.text:
Each hunter gains 1 Rathalos Tail.
Progress to entry 14.

flavor.text: You can hear it. The creature is so near you’re certain you can smell its foetid breath. You push aside branches, waiting to catch a glimpse of the prey you’ve tracked for so long…

prompt.text: It’s ahead. You’re certain. Hunker down, and tread carefully.

rules.text:
Gain 1 track token.
Progress to entry 33.

prompt.text: The trail of the plates continues… keep to the route.

condition.text: (This option can only be chosen if the hunters have at least 1 Rathalos Plate in their inventories)

rules.text: Progress to entry 34.

flavor.text: Scaling the cliffs is a difficult, laborious process. Birds and insects flitter around you, but, as you reach the top, you can finally see the forest stretching out below you—a glistening, breathing organism. You can see how Rathalos picks its targets. Now to start tracking it to its lair.

prompt.text: Keep climbing, there’s a nest above.

rules.text:
Discard 2 time cards. Gain 1 track token.
Progress to entry 28.

prompt.text: There’s another nest, somewhere over to your left.

rules.text:
Each hunter gains 1 Rathalos Webbing.
Discard 1 time card. Progress to entry 19.

flavor.text: You keep trekking into the forest, examining the air and the spruce-covered floor for some sign of Rathalos, but it seems to have evaded you. For the moment, at least.

prompt.text: It might be worth finding a new perspective for the hunt.

rules.text: Progress to entry 22.

prompt.text: Keep on this path through the forest.

rules.text: Gain 1 track token. Progress to entry 7.

flavor.text: Clambering down the rock face in the morning is surprisingly profitable; the brightness of the new sun illuminates a seam of machalite you might have missed had you risked the journey in the dark.

rules.text: Each hunter gains 1 Machalite ore. Progress to entry 12.

flavor.text: An old Rathalos nest. No living creature has dwelled here in some time, but the detritus scattered about the cliff top might contain something of value.

prompt.text: Collect what we can, then continue the hunt.

rules.text:
Each hunter gains 1 Boulder Bone.
Progress to entry 22.

flavor.text: Refreshed from the momentary pause in the hunt, you ready yourself for the next stage of the pursuit.

rules.text: Gain 1 track token. Progress to entry 27.

flavor.text: Rathalos screams, and wheels above you. Is it watching you? or has it spied other prey, deeper into the forest? You can’t tell, but for safety’s sake, you duck back into the shelter of the trees as the wyvern claws at the canopy above.

prompt.text:
Sharp spines fall like a deadly rain from above,
dislodged by thick bark.

rules.text:
Each hunter gains 1 Rathalos Wingtalon.
Gain 1 track token.
Progress to entry 10.

prompt.text:
Something plummets towards you, fallen from
between it’s claws. You rush to catch it.

rules.text:
Each hunter gains 1 Dragonvein Crystal.
Progress to entry 26.

flavor.text: Another victim of Rathalos? You’re not sure, but you know you’re close. You can feel it. Feel the growing adrenaline in your gut. But then you’re confronted by something you didn’t expect… a vast mound of Rathalos droppings. Do you stop and see what Rathalos has consumed lately?

prompt.text: What kind of hunter stops to sift through excrement?

rules.text:
Gain 1 track token.
Progress to entry 32.

prompt.text: Every scrap of information might be useful!

rules.text:
Each hunter rolls on the following table.
1-2 Dragonite ore
3-4 Firecell Stone
5-6 Rathalos Shell
Discard 1 time card. Progress to entry 20.

flavor.text: A deafening roar tears the sky above you, the sun momentarily blocked out by the unfurling of vast, leathery wings. You duck as Rathalos descends, trying to seize you in its talons. It roars again, in agonised frustration. You ready your weapons. Now, it’s time to fight.

rules.text: Discard 2 time cards. Reveal your track tokens, check the Scoutfly level, and begin the hunting phase.

flavor.text: There it is! Rathalos. The beast squats over its prey, huge wings curved around the corpse and shielding it from other predators. It sniffs at the air, then bellows in fury as it senses your presence. You respond with a war cry of your own. Battle begins!

rules.text: Gain 2 track tokens. Reveal your track tokens, check the Scoutfly level, and begin the hunting phase.

flavor.text: There’s a roar of fury from ahead of you. At last, Rathalos, the creature from which you’ve been charged to collect a trophy, waits in the clearing. You charge toward it, the joy of the hunt singing in your muscles!

rules.text: Reveal your track tokens, check the Scoutfly level, and begin the hunting phase.

flavor.text: Compacted air blasts your face, and the sound of vast wings deafens you, quickly replaced by a furious shriek. Rathalos is upon you! The physical impressiveness of the creature still leaves you gasping. You shake yourself, curse under your breath, and hurl yourself upon your prey!

rules.text:
The hunters each suffer 1 damage.
Reveal your track tokens, check the Scoutfly level, and begin the hunting phase.
